headline.main: First, Order Comes to Herat, Then Maybe an Election

lead_paragraph: If all goes according to plan, by this weekend Herat will begin to look more like a normal city and less like the setting for a Mad Max movie. Under an agreement reached last night between two rival political parties, armed troops that have been roaming the city with AK-47's and rocket launchers -- generating considerable unease among the citizenry -- will be relocated to military bases outside the city. A regular, uniformed police force is expected to be in place soon.
abstract: Two rival political parties that helped liberate Herat, Afghanistan, from Taliban agree to relocate armed troops roaming city to bases outside city and put in place regular, uniformed police force; Party of Unity, representing minority ethnic Hazaras and Shiite Muslims, gets own military base and will be integrated into government's security structures, including police; government, controlled by Ismail Khan, says it has regained control of border with Iran from party (M)
